column4: for some reason it takes my internet forever to conenct to a server, but then after that navigation is almost instant... this is with ubuntu... someone mentioned it was probably dns problems... but how do i find out what dns server i want?
because it SEEMS like i need it...
my resolv.conf has nameserver pointing to my router
so does mine, but my dsl modem/router has dns server ...
you can see (what can be seen) in /var/log/dmesg & /var/log/systlog
that is not good, /var/log/syslog is the catchal for system messages. Mine has never been empty, I can't imagine why yours is
composting by def requires a not default X server
the bot doesn't respond back to you anymore
xorg-dev will pull in all the X development headers, probably will give you what you're looking for
I kinda thought tiling went out with windows 1
i dunno i really think tiling wm's could do something great for the desktop if someone could just get it right
